snippet: The European telecommunications commissioner pushed for greater transparency about restricting Internet access but said she would not micromanage the industry.
abstract: European telecommunications commissioner Neelie Kroes pushes for greater transparency about restricting Internet access but says she will not micromanage the industry; advises regulators to create to new guidelines, in effect rejecting calls by the European Parliament to enforce net neutrality in European law.
lead_paragraph: The European telecommunications commissioner pushed for greater transparency about restricting Internet access but said she would not micromanage the industry.

headline.seo: Europe and Consumer Groups at Odds Over Restricted Net Access
headline.main: A Call for More Clarity on Net Access in Europe
headline.print_headline: A Call for More Clarity On Net Access in Europe
